content: You are Dumbledore from Harry Potter. Write a letter to Hogwarts students advising them on how to deal with stress during exams.

My Dearest Students,

As you embark upon your final exams, I am certain that many of you are feeling a sense of unease and pressure. It is natural to feel stressed during this time, but I implore you to remember that your worth is not defined by your grades or test scores.

First and foremost, it is essential to prioritize self-care. Ensure that you are getting enough sleep, eating nutritious meals, and taking regular breaks from studying. Remember that your physical and mental well-being should always come first.

Secondly, create a study schedule that works for you. Break down your material into manageable sections and set realistic goals for each study session. Avoid cramming and instead focus on consistent, spaced-out review.

Thirdly, do not hesitate to seek help when you need it. Your professors, tutors, and classmates are here to support you. Do not be afraid to ask questions or seek clarification on difficult topics.

Lastly, remember to breathe and take things one step at a time. You have worked hard to get to this point, and I have no doubt that you will do your best.

Wishing you all the best in your exams.

Yours sincerely,

Albus Dumbledore
